subtitle: directing clerks both in the Court of Queen's-bench and Common-pleas: in the abbreviation and contraction of words (and thereby the speedy reading of precedents) ...
title: Instructor clericalis ...
subjects: Great Britain. Court of King's Bench
Great Britain. Court of Common Pleas

notes.value:
On t.-p., v.2-5: By R.G., a clerk of the Court of common pleas.
Sub-title of v.2: Being a collection of select and useful precedents of declarations in the King's bench and Common pleas ...; v.3, being a collection of choice and useful precedents for pleadings ...; v.4-5, being a continuance of bars and other pleadings ...
Vol. 1, 5th ed., with additions; v.2, 5th ed., cor. and enl.; v.3, 4th ed., with additions; v.4, 3d ed., with additions; v.5 (2v.) 2d ed., cor.
Vol. 2 has imprint: In the Savoy, Printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling for J. Stephens; v.3 and 5, printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling for J. Walthoe; v.4, printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling, for J. Walthoe and J. Stephens.
